tn: [MASK] ne a dutse hodima sofa, mme ka mmona a tsamaya jwaloka motho ya batlang moya. Mosetsana mongwe o ne a tabogela kwa godimo mme a bula fensetere. Ka bonako fela ke ne ka mmona a tsholetsa seatla mme fa ke ne ke tsenya serokete sa me mo kamoreng ka go lela "Molelo!" Lefoko leno ga le a ka la tswa mo molomong wa me go feta boidiidi jotlhe jwa batho, bo ne bo apere sentle le bo-mangana,+ ba ba sa aparang sentle, ba ba neng ba le mo go yone, ba ba neng ba le mo go yone ba ne ba le makgapha a a neng a le mo go one.+ Go na le maru a a sa tswang go tswa mo mosing le go tswa mo fensetereng e e bulegileng. Ke ne ka lemoga gore go ne go na le kgang e e neng e le teng, mme moragonyana ke ne ka lemoga gore go ne go na le modumo o o sa tswang go [MASK] go tswa mo go bone. Ke ne ka tabogela mo gare ga batho ba ba goelang, ke ne ka tsamaya ka tsela e e yang kwa sekhutlong sa mmila, mme ka nako ya metsotso e le lesome, ke ne ka itumelela go bona letsogo la tsala ya me mo go nna, le gore ke tshabe mo sesulong sa morusu. O ne a tsamaya ka bonako mme a didimala metsotso e se kae go fitlha re sena go tima nngwe ya ditsela tse di didimetseng tse di lebisang kwa Tseleng ya Edgeware.

en_masked: [MASK] had sat up upon the couch, and I saw him motion like a man who is in need of air. A maid rushed across and threw open the window. tn: O ne a re: "Monna yono o ne a nyetse mosadi yo mogolo thata go feta ene ka madi a gagwe," o ne a re, "mme o ne a itumelela go dirisa madi a morwadie fa fela a ntse a nna le bone. E ne e le selo se se botlhokwa thata mo bathong ba ba neng ba le mo go yone, mme ba ne ba latlhegelwa ke matshelo a bone e ne e le go dira pharologanyo e kgolo. Go ne go le botlhokwa go leka go e boloka. Morwadi o ne a le montle, a le pelontle, mme a rata e bile a le matlhagatlhaga mo ditseleng tsa gagwe, ka jalo go ne go bonala gore ka melemo ya gagwe e e siameng, le lotseno le lennye, a ka se letlelelwe go nna lobaka lo loleele. Ke eng se se bontshang gore lenyalo la lona le tla latlhegelwa ke dingwaga di le 100, ka jalo, ke eng se a neng a se dira gore a se ka a se dira? O ne a tsaya tsela e e utlwalang sentle ya go mo thusa gore a nne le ene kwa gae mme a mo kganela gore a batle batho ba dingwaga tsa gagwe. Mme go ise go ye kae, o ne a lemoga gore seo ga se kitla se araba ka bosakhutleng. O ne a nna a le pelo e e siameng, mme kwa bofelong o ne a lemoga gore o ne a na le maikaelelo a a siameng a go ya kwa kgweleng e e rileng. Ke eng se se botlhale jo bo bontshang gore o ne a dira eng ka nako eo? O na le kgopolo e e utlwalang sentle mo tlhogong ya gagwe go na le go mo thusa. A re o ne a bua le mosadi wa gagwe yo o neng a le mo go ene, o ne a tlhotlhomisitse matlho a gagwe ka digalase tse di kwa godimo, a kopanya sefatlhego ka leswana le le nang le leswana le lennye, a latlhela lentswe le le utlwalang le le utlwalang le le kwa godimo, mme a ipeakanya ka go ipusolosetsa ka go rata mosetsana yo monnye, a supa fa a [MASK], mme a tlogela barati ba bangwe ka go mo rata." - Baheb.

Vola be izany, ho an'ny olona eo amin'ny toerany, ary mety ho nitondra fiovana lehibe ny fahaverezan'izany. Tsy very maina ny ezaka natao mba hiarovana azy io. Nanana toetra tsara sy mahafinaritra ilay zanakavavy, saingy be fitiavana sy mafana fo tamin'ny fombany, ka hita miharihary fa noho ny tombontsoany manokana ara-drariny, sy ny fidiram-bolany kely, dia tsy ho afaka hijanona ho mpitovo ela izy. Mazava ho azy fa ho very zato taona ny fanambadiany, ka inona no ataon'ny dadany mba hisorohana izany? Ataony mazava tsara ny fomba fihazonana azy ao an-trano ary mandrara azy tsy hitady olona mitovy taona aminy. Tsy ela anefa dia hitany fa tsy hisy vokany mandrakizay izany. Lasa tony izy, nisisika tamin'ny zony, ary farany dia nanambara ny fikasany tsara handeha ho any amin'ny baolina iray. Inona √†ry no ataon'ny rainy marani - tsaina? Mamorona hevitra iray azo itokisana kokoa amin'ny lohany izy noho ny ao am-pony. Tamin'ny alalan'ny fiaraha-miory sy ny fanampian'ny vadiny no nanafenany ny tenany, nanarona ireo maso mavitrika ireo tamin'ny solomaso miloko miloko, nanarona ny tarehy tamin'ny volombava sy volombava roa, nandona izany feo mazava izany tao anatin'ny bitsika mifono tsindrimandry, ary azo antoka roa heny noho ny fahitana fohy nataon'ilay zazavavy, hita ho toy ny [MASK] izy, ary manakana ireo mpifankatia hafa amin'ny alalan'ny fitiavana ny tenany."

The daughter was of a good, amiable disposition, but affectionate and warm-hearted in her ways, so that it was evident that with her fair personal advantages, and her little income, she would not be allowed to remain single long. Now her marriage would mean, of course, the loss of a hundred a year, so what does her epfather do to prevent it? He takes the obvious course of keeping her at home and forbidding her to seek the company of people of her own age. But soon he found that that would not answer forever. She became restive, insisted upon her rights, and finally announced her positive intention of going to a certain ball. What does her clever epfather do then? He conceives an idea more creditable to his head than to his heart. With the connivance and assistance of his wife he disguised himself, covered those keen eyes with tinted glasses, masked the face with a moustache and a pair of bushy whiskers, sunk that clear voice into an insinuating whisper, and doubly secure on account of the girl‚Äôs short sight, he appears as [MASK], and keeps off other lovers by making love himself.‚Äù

mg: "Nandositra izahay tamin'izay, ary adiny iray farafahakeliny no nitondranay fiara. Nilaza ny Kolonely [MASK] fa fito kilaometatra monja izany, saingy tokony hieritreritra aho, raha ny taha izay toa alehanay, ary hatramin'ny fotoana nandraisantsika azy, dia tsy maintsy ho efa manakaiky ny roa ambin'ny folo taona izany. Nipetraka teo anilako tamim-pahanginana foana izy, ary fantatro fa imbetsaka aho no nijery ahy tamin'ny lalany, fa nijery ahy tamin'ny fomba mahery vaika izy. Toa tsy dia tsara loatra ny lalana ao amin'io faritra io eto amin'izao tontolo izao, satria nitsoaka sy nitsoaka mafy izahay. Niezaka nijery avy teo am-baravarankely aho mba hijery zavatra iray izay nisy anay, saingy vita tamin'ny fitaratra mangatsiaka izy ireo, ary tsy afaka nanao na inona na inona afa-tsy ny fanjavozavoan'ny hazavana iray mandalo tsindraindray aho. Ankehitriny ary avy eo aho dia nanao fanamarihana vitsivitsy mba handrava ny maha-tokana ny dia, saingy tamin'ny alalan'ny monosyllables ihany no namalian'ilay kolonely azy, ary tsy ela dia nisosa ny resaka. Tamin'ny farany anefa, dia nifanakalozana tamin'ny fahamoran'ny kodiaran'ny vatokely ny fikorisan'ny lalana, ary tonga teo amin'ny lampihazo ilay fiara. Nipoitra [MASK] Kolonely ary rehefa nanaraka azy aho dia nisintona ahy haingana ho any amin'ny lavarangana iray izay banga teo anoloanay. Toy ny hoe nivoaka avy tao anaty fiara izahay ary niditra tao amin'ny lalantsara, ka tsy afaka nijery ny teo anoloan'ny trano aho. Vantany vao niampita ny tokonam-baravarana aho dia namely mafy ny varavarana tao aorianay, ary henoko kely ny kodiaran'ny kodiarana rehefa nandeha ny fiara.

en_masked: ‚ÄúAway we went then, and we drove for at least an hour. Colonel [MASK] had said that it was only seven miles, but I should think, from the rate that we seemed to go, and from the time that we took, that it must have been nearer twelve. He sat at my side in silence all the time, and I was aware, more than once when I glanced in his direction, that he was looking at me with great intensity. The country roads seem to be not very good in that part of the world, for we lurched and jolted terribly. I tried to look out of the windows to see something of where we were, but they were made of frosted glass, and I could make out nothing save the occasional bright blur of a passing light. Now and then I hazarded some remark to break the monotony of the journey, but the colonel answered only in monosyllables, and the conversation soon flagged. At last, however, the bumping of the road was exchanged for the crisp smoothness of a gravel-drive, and the carriage came to a stand. Colonel [MASK] sprang out, and, as I followed after him, pulled me swiftly into a porch which gaped in front of us. We stepped, as it were, right out of the carriage and into the hall, so that I failed to catch the most fleeting glance of the front of the house. The instant that I had crossed the threshold the door slammed heavily behind us, and I heard faintly the rattle of the wheels as the carriage drove away.
